intro: Artemisia orbicularis, commonly known as the roundleaf wormwood, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its grayish-green, silvery foliage with rounded, orbicular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Artemisia orbicularis is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is valued in traditional medicine for its aromatic properties and is also used as a ornamental plant in gardens.
